intro: Tragia betonicifolia, commonly known as the "hairy false hellebore," is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Tragia betonicifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution.
